snippet: Michael Hoomanawanui appeared in 14 games during the regular season, missing two with a concussion, then stepped in for the injured Rob Gronkowski in the Patriots’ win over the Texans.
abstract: New England Patriots, who are preparing to face Baltimore Ravens in AFC title game, will rely on tight end Michael Hoomanawanui for the rest of postseason to replace injured tight end Rob Gronkowski.
lead_paragraph: Michael Hoomanawanui appeared in 14 games during the regular season, missing two with a concussion, then stepped in for the injured Rob Gronkowski in the Patriots’ win over the Texans.

headline.seo: Michael Hoomanawanui Eager to Help the Patriots
headline.main: Tight End Eager to Help Suddenly Has a Job to Do
headline.print_headline: Tight End Eager to Help Suddenly Has a Job to Do
